summary: The Crime Victims Fund Stabilization Act of 2025 aims to clarify and increase deposits into the Crime Victims Fund. It amends the Victims of Crime Act of 1984 to include funds from declined criminal prosecutions and other similar dispositions. Furthermore, it temporarily allows for deposits from settlements related to the False Claims Act, excluding funds for qui tam plaintiffs and government damage reimbursements, into the fund. The bill is sponsored by Ms. Murkowski and others.
